definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Probably the most noticeable thing we would see is the big, important seat of the judge.
sentences.chinese: 最顯眼的可能就是法官所坐的大靠背椅。

sentences.english: The picture was hung on the line.
sentences.chinese: 在牆上顯眼的地方掛着一幅畫。

sentences.english: Its distinctly toothed leaves are carried on branching stems.
sentences.chinese: 在其分支的莖杆上，掛滿了非常顯眼的鋸齒狀樹葉。

sentences.english: His red clothes stood out clearly against the snow.
sentences.chinese: 他的紅衣服在白雪中格外顯眼。

sentences.english: When I was last in China, my loose-fitting, mix-and-match preppy-catalog clothing stood out.
sentences.chinese: 我最後一次在中國時，我寬鬆隨意的衣着很是顯眼。

sentences.english: Don't sweep the leaves into the square where they will be noticed.
sentences.chinese: 別將樹葉掃進廣場，那太顯眼了。

sentences.english: Prominent anti-American slogans in Tienanmen Square have still not been taken down.
sentences.chinese: 天安門廣場上顯眼的反美標語仍沒有被撤下。

sentences.english: If you're walking along a badly-lit road at night you should wear conspicuous clothes.
sentences.chinese: 晚上在照明很差的路上行走，應該穿顯眼的衣物。

sentences.english: I found a male lesser cuckoo singing on the top of a tree, very outstanding place.
sentences.chinese: 我看見一隻雄性的小杜鵑在顯眼的樹頂唱歌。

sentences.english: You should have a white chest grasping conspicuous finger mark.
sentences.chinese: 你雪白雪白的胸前竟有一抓顯眼的指痕。

sentences.english: As is shown in the drawing, the old man with long white beard is most eye-catcing.
sentences.chinese: 如圖所示，這個長着長長的白鬍子的老人是最顯眼的。

sentences.english: The houses prominently featured in that show.
sentences.chinese: 這些建築在那部劇中很顯眼。

sentences.english: Red flags stand out against the blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 紅旗在藍旗的襯托下很顯眼。
龍的血盆大口分外顯眼，顯然是一隻兇險的野獸。

sentences.english: They really look sharp, very sharp.
sentences.chinese: 他們看上去很顯眼，非常顯眼。

sentences.english: They really look sharp, very sharp.
sentences.chinese: 他們看上去很顯眼，非常顯眼。

definition: (of alcohol) to go to one's head/(old) (of a bride-to-be) to bind one's hair into a bun/(of a prostitute) to receive a patron for the first time
above/on top of/on the surface of
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
